Package hw1

Class InventorySet

java.lang.Object
hw1.InventorySet
final class InventorySet extends Object
An Inventory implemented using a HashMap<Video,Record>. Keys are Videos; Values are Records.

  • Method Details

    • size

      public int size()
      Return the number of Records.

    • get

      public Record get(VideoObj v)
      Return a copy of the record for a given Video; if not present, return null.

    • toCollection

      public Collection<Record> toCollection()
      Return a copy of the records as a collection. Neither the underlying collection, nor the actual records are returned.

    • addNumOwned

      public void addNumOwned(VideoObj video, int change)
      Add or remove copies of a video from the inventory. If a video record is not already present (and change is positive), a record is created. If a record is already present, numOwned is modified using change. If change brings the number of copies to be zero, the record is removed from the inventory.
      Parameters:
      video - the video to be added.
      change - the number of copies to add (or remove if negative).
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if video null, change is zero, if attempting to remove more copies than are owned, or if attempting to remove copies that are checked out.

    • checkOut

      public void checkOut(VideoObj video)
      Check out a video.
      Parameters:
      video - the video to be checked out.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if video has no record or numOut equals numOwned.

    • checkIn

      public void checkIn(VideoObj video)
      Check in a video.
      Parameters:
      video - the video to be checked in.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if video has no record or numOut non-positive.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Remove all records from the inventory.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Return the contents of the inventory as a string.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
